Definition / general

* Inclusions of benign mesothelial cells in lymph nodes* Often missed on routine H&E sections ([Am J Surg Pathol 1999;23:1264](10524528))* Hyperplastic mesothelial cells in nodal tissue may derive from reactive serosal mesothelium that is dislodged into draining lymphatics ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 2000;124:609](10747321))* Often associated with serosal fluid collection (pericardial, pleural, abdominal) at time of nodal biopsy ([Hum Pathol 1998;29:339](9563782)), including episodes of intraperitoneal hemorrhage and ascites ([Pathology 2001;33:239](11358062)), perhaps because effusion allows for mesothelial cell migration into lymphatics ([Diagn Cytopathol 2003;29:163](12951686))

Terminology

* Benign mesothelial inclusions* Benign metastasizing mesothelial cells

Sites

* Mediastinal and abdominal lymph nodes* Rare - cervical lymph nodes

Etiology

* Transportation of these cells through the lymphatics to the lymph node during injury or manipulation at the primary site of the origin* They undergo a degeneration, and thus it becomes difficult to find them

Clinical features

* Incidental finding* Enlarged lymph nodes* Site specific symptoms

Enlarged lymph node due to mesothelial inclusion

Prognostic factors

* Benign process with no significant clinical implications

Case reports

* 12 year old boy with diffuse hyperplastic mesothelial cells in multiple lymph nodes ([Int J Clin Exp Pathol 2013;6:926](23638225))* 16 year old boy with mesothelial cell inclusions mimicking adenocarcinoma ([Indian J Med Paediatr Oncol 2010;31:62](21209767))* 18 year old woman with benign metastasizing mesothelial cells ([J Clin Oncol 2011;29:e546](21482984))* 52 year old woman with mesothelial pelvic lymph node inclusions mimicking metastatic thyroid carcinoma ([Gynecol Oncol 1998;68:210](9514806))* Mesothelial cell inclusions in mediastinal lymph nodes mimicking metastatic carcinoma ([Am J Clin Pathol 1990;93:741](2161177))* Mesothelial cell inclusions within mediastinal lymph nodes ([Histopathology 1994;25:483](7868088))* Mesothelial pelvic lymph node inclusion in a patient with ovarian microinvasive borderline mucinous tumor ([Int J Gynecol Cancer 2007;17:917](17316363))* Benign hyperplastic mesothelial cells in lymph node ([Int J Surg Pathol 2007;15:297](17652541))

Treatment

* Depends upon the clinical presentation / underlying cause* In incidental findings, none necessary

Gross description

* Enlarged lymph nodes with yellowish tan to gray white, smooth to mottled surface

Microscopic (histologic) description

* Small clusters and singly scattered, round to polygonal cells, seen in the subcapsular and interfollicular sinuses of the nodes* These cells show a round, vesicular nucleus with small nucleolus* The nuclear - cytoplasmic ratio is low* No mitotic activity is detected* There is no extranodal or parenchymal infiltration of the cells* Tiny spaces are seen in between the cells of the clusters (mesothelial windows)

Positive stains

* [Cytokeratin AE1 / AE3](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsae1ae3.html), [cytokeratin 7 (CK7)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsck7.html)* [Calretinin](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainscalretinin.html) (nuclear and cytoplasmic), [WT1](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainswt1.html), [CK5](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsck5.html) / [6](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsck6.html), [CAIX](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainscarbonicanhydraseix.html) (membranous)* [EMA](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsema.html) (weak and cytoplasmic)

Differential diagnosis

* [Lymphangioma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/softtissuelymphangioma.html): multicystic, has smooth muscle and lymphocytes in cyst wall and lumen, [keratin](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsckgeneral.html)+* [Metastatic adenocarcinoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/lymphnodesmetastases.html)* [Metastatic mesothelioma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/lymphnodesmetastases.html)* **Mucinous cystadenoma**: ovarian-like stroma, [mucin](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsmucins.html)+, [CEA](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainscea.html)+, negative for **hyaluronic acid*** [Müllerian inclusions](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/lymphnodesotherectopic.html#mullerianinclusions): [ER](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainser.html)+; negative for [calretinin](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainscalretinin.html), [CK5](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsck5.html) / [6](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsck6.html); [PAX8](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainspax8.html) can be positive in both* **Simple hemorrhagic cyst**: [keratin](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsckgeneral.html)-* [Sinus histiocytosis](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/lymphnodessinushistiocytosiswithmassivelymph.html)
